content: So, we're able to build a rustc and libstd on x86-64-darwin that runs on aarch64-darwin. Looking forward a few steps, what's the general path to getting that "somewhere special" so that people could download it if they wanted? I'm guessing that it's not "upload a random binary that @Jake Goulding built to some rust server".

hm so I imagine if you can open a WIP PR that does this then we could edit try.yml and get a try build for apple going -- we don't want to do that a lot since we're quite limited on mac capacity IIRC but a couple builds shouldn't hurt too much I think, especially if you try and wait till after an auto build is going
@Jake Goulding Well that is possible with rustup-toolchain-install-master. It will let you download rustup artifacts from anywhere. https://github.com/kennytm/rustup-toolchain-install-master
Ah, I’ve used that to get ci artifacts; didn’t realize it could go from arbitrary places.
